ep.io is like heroku for wsgi apps.
WebFaction's your best best if you don't want to setup your own server.

That'll suit your needs well, except CentOS is a bit hard to deal with sometimes. Linode is good because they let you pick your own OS, like ubuntu 10.10, which makes a lot of things much easier
@theasoto to be honest, you'd probably be best off with a $20 a month VPS from http://linode.com

I got vps from wired tree. I got tired of the problems at media temple. Like any vps you can do whatever the heck you want with it. The customer service is amazing and the managed vps is a good option.
pretty sure you can't run an XMPP server on Webfaction or ep.io
most of the shared / managed hosting environments are out for that requirement, simply because they won't let you open random ports. it's HTTP or nothing.
but if you're planning on doing long-polling from a browser client anyways, it might be possible to expose the BOSH interface

mediatemple sucks. and so does the centos and i been trying to figure out a fast cheap way to get a xmpp server running but i still havent found one, i may just find a server that has red5 support and use flash idk tho. and ep.io is just a python server but yeah ur right.
BTW, if you need XMPP and ffmpeg and stuff, try Rackspace Cloud
